required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Postoperative Early Period Quality of Life of Patients With Open and Robot Assisted Kidney Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Postoperative Early Period Quality of Life of Patients With Open and Robot Assisted Kidney Transplantation: a Prospective Observational Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to investigate the quality of life in patients with end-stage renal disease who underwent open or robot-assisted renal transplantation. Also, the investigators sought to determine the parameters which can affect the quality of life in these patients

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who underwent open or robot-assisted renal transplantation at Bakirkoy Sadi Konuk Training and Research Hospital between June 2016 and December 2018 constituted the target population of this study. After application of the inclusion and exclusion criteria, the patient group was divided into two groups as per the surgical technique (i.e., open vs. robot-assisted). Demographic data, preoperative and postoperative data of all patients were collected prospectively. The quality of life of the patients was assessed preoperatively and on the postoperative 30th day

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of change for Quality of Life (measure : Short Form 36) after open and robot assisted renal transplantation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From just before the treatment and up to 30 days after the surgery was performed
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of change for quality of life (measure : Short Form 36) for patients who performed open and robot assisted renal transplantation due to end stage renal disease. Scores of the Short Form-36 Health Survey vary between 0 and 100, a score of 0 corresponds to the lowest quality, while 100 indicates the highest quality.

arm_group.description: Patients who were performed open renal transplantation due to end stage renal disease.
Patients who were performed robot assisted renal transplantation due to end stage renal disease

intervention.description: Open or robot assisted renal transplantation

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were performed open or robot assisted renal transplantation due to End Stage Renal Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged between 18 and 75
- Who were diagnosed with End Stage Renal Disease (i.e., estimated glomerular filtration rate loer than 20 ml/minute or symptomatic uremia or dialysis requirement)
- Received a kidney from a live donor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with mental retardation, dementia, and psychotic or cognitive disorders, including delirium
- Patients who underwent deceased renal transplantation and who underwent simple bilateral nephrectomy or any other surgical procedure concurrent with Open renal transplantation
- Patients who died or had graft failure during the study period

overall_official.affiliation: Bakırkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Training and Research Hospital

facility.name: Bakirkoy Dr Sadi Konuk Training and Research Hospital, Department of Urology
